newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ivory Coast - June 27.

text.p: These are significant items in the Ivorian press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these items and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Henri Konan Bedie addressed UNESCO in Paris at presentation of a peace prize to Guatemalan President Alvaro Arzu and Guatemalan guerrilla leader Rolando Moran. Prize is named after Ivory Coast's independence president, Felix Houphouet-Boigny.

- Laurent Gbagbo, leader of the opposition Ivorian Popular Front (FPI), meets Clare Short, Britain's new Minister for International Development. He travelled to Britain from the United States, and plans to go from there to see political leaders in France and Italy.

- France reviews the role of its armed forces in Africa, and President Jacques Chirac has signalled that in future trouble spots ought to be policed by an inter-African force under the authority of the Organisation of African Unity (OAU).
